description:
At Google, we build products that organize the world's information and make it universally accessible to our users. These products are the lifeblood of who we are. As part of the Product Management team, you work closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. You connect the technical and with the business, working with teams across Engineering, Sales, Marketing and Finance. With your technical expertise, you identify a project’s setback and generate solutions for resolving them quickly. As a Product Manager, you help shape the future of Google products.

In this role, you'll use your technical and business experience to drive hardware and software collaboration between Engineering teams and Software teams. You'll work cross-functionally to assess and select key problems to solve, build long-term strategies and roadmaps, and secure executive support. You'll drive internal stakeholder and partner engagements and work to stick to product timelines.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 7 years of product management experience for consumer product launches.
  • Experience working with cross-functional teams, including Software/Product Engineering, Industrial/Product Design, Sales, Marketing, Finance, Supply Chain, Customer Support, Partnerships, and Legal.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Master's degree in relevant technical field.
  • Experience with consumer hardware development life cycles and ODM/CM working models.
  • Familiarity with computing and mobile operating systems and software application development life cycles.
  • Demonstrated analytical skills and business acumen.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to advocate for initiatives, internally and externally, with executive management and external partners.
responsibilities:
• Drive the roadmap strategy in collaboration with Engineering,  Device/Software Product Managers, and Research to create differentiation for products. Partner closely with Product teams across Google to understand their vision, objectives and opportunities for strategic alignment.
  • Evaluate new applications, use cases, proof-of-concepts, technologies and standards, and advocate for/against adoption based on system-level considerations.
  • Drive early and ongoing alignment between Engineering and Product Management, Software and UX teams.
  • Build business metrics into overall product/device plan to drive scalable and balanced growth.
  • Establish relationships with ecosystem partners to develop in-depth  knowledge of capabilities and roadmaps.
title: Product Manager, Hardware
